## OpenAlex versus others  {.extra-small}

|                       | Number of works  | OA works    | Citations | Price        | Data Openness             | Org structure |
| --------------------- | ---------------- | ----------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------------------- | ------------- |
| OpenAlex              | 243M             | 48M         | 1.9B      | Freemium     | Fully open, CC0 license   | Non-profit    |
| Scopus                | 87M              | [20.5M](https://blog.scopus.com/posts/scopus-now-includes-90-million-content-records) | 1.8B      | Subscription | Closed                    | For Profit    |
| Web of Science (core) | 87M (ref)        | [12M](https://clarivate.com/webofsciencegroup/solutions/open-access/)   | 1.8B      | Subscription | Closed                    | For Profit    |
| Dimensions            | 135M             | [29M](https://www.dimensions.ai/resources/evaluate-your-universitys-oa-status/)   | 1.7B      | Freemium     | Partly open, personal use | For Profit    |
| Google Scholar        | 389M (estimated) | ?           | ?         | Free         | Closed                    | For Profit    |
| Crossref              | 145M             | 20M         | 1.45B     | Free         | Fully open, CC0 license   | Non-profit    |

## Write Python Code
```{.python code-line-numbers="|6|9"}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

## Write R Code

#| code-line-numbers: "|2|4"
